intro: Oplotheca floridana, commonly known as the Florida oplotheca, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Oplotheca floridana typically grows in wetlands and along waterways, thriving in moist, sandy soils. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small organisms.
